actr.model
Class Vision

java.lang.Object
  actr.model.Module
      actr.model.Vision

public class Vision
extends Module

The vision module representing ACT-R's visual perception.

Author:
Dario Salvucci

Method Detail

clearVisual

public void clearVisual()
Clears the visual module of all visual objects.

addVisual

public void addVisual(java.lang.String id,
                      java.lang.String type,
                      java.lang.String value,
                      int x,
                      int y,
                      int w,
                      int h,
                      double d)
Adds a visual object for access by the vision module. The identifier should be unique for different sounds; if the same identifier is used, the new object will cancel the previous one (as might be useful for the movements of a single object).

Parameters:
id - the unique name of the visual object
type - the type of the visual object (i.e., the "kind" slot value)
value - the value of the visual object (i.e., the "value" slot value)
x - the x coordinate of the visual object (i.e., the "screen-x" slot value)
y - the y coordinate of the visual object (i.e., the "screen-y" slot value)
w - the width of the visual object (i.e., the "width" slot value)
h - the height of the visual object (i.e., the "height" slot value)
d - the distance of the visual object (i.e., the "distance" slot value)

addVisual

public void addVisual(java.lang.String id,
                      java.lang.String type,
                      java.lang.String value,
                      int x,
                      int y,
                      int w,
                      int h)
Adds a visual object for access by the vision module. The identifier should be unique for different sounds; if the same identifier is used, the new object will cancel the previous one (as might be useful for the movements of a single object).

Parameters:
id - the unique name of the visual object
type - the type of the visual object (i.e., the "kind" slot value)
value - the value of the visual object (i.e., the "value" slot value)
x - the x coordinate of the visual object (i.e., the "screen-x" slot value)
y - the y coordinate of the visual object (i.e., the "screen-y" slot value)
w - the width of the visual object (i.e., the "width" slot value)
h - the height of the visual object (i.e., the "height" slot value)

moveVisual

public void moveVisual(java.lang.String id,
                       int x,
                       int y)
Moves the given visual object to a new location.

Parameters:
id - the unique name of the visual object
x - the x coordinate of the visual object (i.e., the "screen-x" slot value)
y - the y coordinate of the visual object (i.e., the "screen-y" slot value)
